bar code.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a group of thin and thick lines printed on products you buy in a shop, that a computer can read. It contains information such as the price.
bar code.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a series of lines printed on products sold in a shop that can be read by a machine connected to a computer to give the price, keep a record of the sale etc
bar code.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The scanner at the checkout recognises the bar code and charges the correct amount.
